meanings.definition: One who solicits business, employment, support, or patronage aggressively.
meanings.sent1: The touter outside the store was trying to attract customers with special offers.
meanings.sent2: The touter at the event was promoting a new product to everyone passing by.
meanings.sent3: The touter's enthusiasm for getting people to sign up for the newsletter was contagious.
meanings.sent4: She was a touter of positivity, always encouraging others to see the bright side.
meanings.sent5: The touter's persuasive skills made it hard to resist their sales pitch.

meanings.definition: To solicit business, employment, support, or patronage aggressively.
meanings.sent1: He would touter potential clients by highlighting the benefits of his services.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to touter new investors to expand their business.
meanings.sent3: She would touter for votes during the election campaign, trying to win over undecided voters.
meanings.sent4: The politician would touter for support, promising positive changes for the community.
meanings.sent5: The street performer would touter for attention by showcasing his unique talents.
